text: Any purported remedy is illusory, inadequate and ineffective since, inter alia, the operation in question in this case was officially organised, planned and executed by agents of the State and having regard, inter alia, to the situation in South-East Turkey which is such that potential applicants have a well-founded fear of the consequences if they should pursue remedies.

text: The Commission considers, in the light of the parties' submissions, that the case raises complex issues of law and fact under the Convention, the determination of which should depend on an examination of the merits of the application as a whole. The Commission concludes, therefore, that the application is not manifestly ill- founded, within the meaning of Article 27 para. 2 (Art. 27-2) of the Convention.

text: Relevant domestic law and practice
label: non-argumentative

text: Civil and administrative procedures
label: non-argumentative

text: Article 125 of the Turkish Constitution provides as follows:
label: non-argumentative

text: (translation)
label: non-argumentative

text: "All acts or decisions of the Administration are subject to judicial review ...
label: non-argumentative

text: The Administration shall be liable for damage caused by its own acts and measures."
label: non-argumentative

text: The Government assert that this provision is not subject to any restrictions even in a state of emergency or war.
label: non-argumentative

text: The latter requirement of the provision does not necessarily require proof of the existence of any fault on the part of the Administration, whose liability is of an absolute, objective nature, based on a theory of "social risk".
label: non-argumentative

text: Thus the Administration may indemnify people who have suffered damage from acts committed by unknown or terrorist authors when the State may be said to have failed in its duty to maintain public order and safety, or in its duty to safeguard individual life and property.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['administration may indemnify people', 'who have suffer damage', ' mitte author', 'state may be say ', ' to have fail duty', ' to maintain order', ' to safeguard life']

text: The principle of administrative liability is reflected in the additional Article 1 of Law 2935 of 25 October 1983 on the State of Emergency, which provides:
label: non-argumentative

text: (translation)
label: non-argumentative

text: "... actions for compensation in relation to the exercise of the powers conferred by this law are to be brought against the Administration before the administrative courts."
label: non-argumentative
events: [' ferre law', ' to be bring administration', 'company rt ']

text: Proceedings before the administrative courts are in writing.
label: non-argumentative

text: Any illegal act by civil servants, be it a crime or tort, which causes material or moral damage may be the subject of a claim for compensation before the ordinary civil courts and the administrative courts.
label: non-argumentative

text: Damage caused by terrorist violence may be compensated out of the Social Help and Solidarity Fund.
label: non-argumentative

text: The Turkish Criminal Code makes it a criminal offence:
label: non-argumentative

text: to deprive someone unlawfully of his or her liberty (Article 179 generally, Article 181 in respect of civil servants),
label: non-argumentative
events: [' to deprive someone', ' to deprive liberty']

text: to oblige someone through force or threats to commit or not to commit an act (Article 188),
label: non-argumentative
events: [' to oblige someone', ' to oblige force']

text: to issue threats (Article 191),
label: non-argumentative

text: to make an unlawful search of someone's home (Articles 193 and 194),
label: non-argumentative
events: [' to make search', ' to make article']

text: to commit arson (Articles 369, 370, 371, 372) or aggravated arson if human life is endangered (Article 382),
label: non-argumentative

text: to commit arson unintentionally by carelessness, negligence or inexperience (Article 383), or
label: non-argumentative

text: to damage another's property intentionally (Article 526 et seq.).
label: non-argumentative
events: [' to damage property', ' to damage seq', ' to damage .']

text: For all these offences, complaints may be lodged, pursuant to Articles 151 and 153 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, with the public prosecutor or the local administrative authorities.
label: non-argumentative

text: The public prosecutor and the police have a duty to investigate crimes reported to them, the former deciding whether a prosecution should be initiated, pursuant to Article 148 of the Code of Criminal Procedure. A complainant may appeal against the decision of the public prosecutor not to institute criminal proceedings.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['prosecutor have duty', ' to investigate crime', ' report they', 'former decide ', 'prosecution should be initiate ', 'plainant may appeal decision', ' to institute proceeding']

text: If the suspected authors of the contested acts are military personnel, they may also be prosecuted for causing extensive damage, endangering human lives or damaging property, if they have not followed orders in conformity with Articles 86 and 87 of the Military Code.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['they may be prosecute ', ' cause damage', ' endanger life', ' damage property', 'they have follow order']

text: Proceedings in these circumstances may be initiated by the persons concerned (non-military) before the competent authority under the Code of Criminal Procedure, or before the suspected persons' hierarchical superior (Articles 93 and 95 of Law 353 on the Constitution and the Procedure of Military Courts).
label: non-argumentative
events: ['proceeding may be initiate person', 'proceeding may be initiate authority']

text: If the alleged author of a crime is a State official or civil servant, permission to prosecute must be obtained from local administrative councils.
label: non-argumentative

text: The local council decisions may be appealed to the State Council; a refusal to prosecute is subject to an automatic appeal of this kind.
label: non-argumentative

text: Articles 13 to 15 of the Constitution provide for fundamental limitations on constitutional safeguards.
label: non-argumentative

text: Provisional Article 15 of the Constitution provides that there can be no allegation of unconstitutionality in respect of measures taken under laws or decrees having the force of law and enacted between 12 September 1980 and 25 October 1983.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['article provide ', ' take law', ' have force', ' enact september']

text: That includes Law 2935 on the State of Emergency of 25 October 1983, under which decrees have been issued which are immune from judicial challenge.
label: non-argumentative

text: Extensive powers have been granted to the Regional Governor of the State of Emergency by such decrees, especially Decree 285, as amended by Decrees 424 and 425, and Decree 430.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['power have be grant decree', ' amend decree']

text: Decree 285 modifies the application of Law 3713, the Anti-Terror Law (1981), in those areas subject to the state of emergency, with the effect that the decision to prosecute members of the security forces is removed from the public prosecutor and conferred on local administrative councils.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['decree modify application', 'decree modify area', 'decree modify effect', ' to prosecute member', 'decision be remove prosecutor', ' ferre ncil']

text: Article 8 of Decree 430 of 16 December 1990 provides as follows:
label: non-argumentative

text: No criminal, financial or legal responsibility may be claimed against the State of Emergency Regional Governor or a Provincial Governor within a state of emergency region in respect of their decisions or acts connected with the exercise of the powers entrusted to them by this decree, and no application shall be made to any judicial authority to this end.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['responsibility may be claim governor', 'responsibility may be claim respect', ' entrust decree', 'application shall be make authority', 'application shall be make end']

text: This is without prejudice to the rights of an individual to claim indemnity from the State for damages suffered by them without justification.
label: non-argumentative
events: [' to claim indemnity', ' to claim state', ' to claim damage', ' to claim justification', ' suffer they']

text: The applicants allege that they have been the victims of the following violations of the Convention:
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 2 on account of the life-threatening attack to which they were subjected by agents of the State.
label: non-argumentative

text: Alternatively, a violation of Article 2 on account of the threat to life occasioned by gross recklessness on the parts of agents of the State, in violation of the State's obligation to protect their right to life.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 2 on account of the lack of any effective system for ensuring protection of the right to life.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 2 on account of the inadequate protection of the right to life in domestic law.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 14 in conjunction with each head of claim under Article 2.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 3 on account of an inhuman and degrading treatment whilst firing was going on, in front of the Security Directorate and whilst they were subject to the curfew.
label: non-argumentative

text: This represents a form of collective punishment which is, in itself, in violation of Article 3.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 14, in conjunction with Article 3.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 3 on account of discrimination on grounds of race or ethnic origin.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 5 on account of complete lack of security of the person.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 6 on account of the impossibility of challenging the deprivation of property before it took place, which represents a denial of access to court for a determination of civil rights.
label: non-argumentative
events: [' challenge deprivation', 'it take place', 'which represent denial']

text: A violation of Article 6 on account of the failure to initiate proceedings before an independent and impartial tribunal against those responsible for the life-threatening attacks and destruction of property, as a result of which they cannot bring civil proceedings out of the attack and destruction.
label: non-argumentative
events: [' to initiate proceeding', 'they can not bring proceeding']

text: A violation of Article 8 on account of the destruction of the homes of the applicants.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 1 of Protocol 1 on account of the destruction of the applicants' homes and possessions.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 14, in conjunction with Articles 5, 6 and 8 of the Convention and Article 1 of Protocol 1 on account of an administrative practice of discrimination on grounds of race or ethnic origin.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 13 on account of the lack of any independent national authority before which these complaints can be brought with any prospect of success.
label: non-argumentative

text: A violation of Article 18 because the interferences in the exercise of the Convention rights are not designed to secure the ends permitted under the Convention.
label: non-argumentative

text: The applicants maintain that there is no requirement that they pursue alleged domestic remedies.
label: non-argumentative

text: According to them, any alleged remedy is illusory, inadequate and ineffective because
label: non-argumentative

text: the operation which led to the threat of life and destruction in question in this case was officially organised, planned and executed by agents of the State;
label: non-argumentative
events: ['which lead threat', 'operation be organise ', 'operation plan ', ' execute agent']

text: there is an administrative practice of not respecting the rule under Article 13 of the Convention which requires the provision of effective domestic remedies;
label: non-argumentative
events: ['there be practice', ' respect rule', 'which require provision']

text: whether or not there is an administrative practice, domestic remedies are ineffective in this case owing to the failure of the legal system to provide redress;
label: non-argumentative
events: ['there be practice', ' owe failure', ' to provide redress']

text: alternatively, the applicants have done everything they can to exhaust domestic remedies by obtaining a determination of damage; the fact that none of them has received any compensation or assistance confirms the ineffectiveness of any alleged remedy.

text: The application was introduced on 20 April 1994 and registered on 9 May 1994.
label: non-argumentative

text: The applicants complain that the security forces carried out a life-threatening attack on their town during which their homes and property were burnt and destroyed.
label: non-argumentative

text: They invoke Article 2 (Art. 2) (the right to life), Article 3 (Art. 3) (the prohibition on inhuman and degrading treatment), Article 5 (Art. 5) (the right to liberty and security of person), Article 6 (Art. 6) (the right of access to court), Article 8 (Art. 8) (the right to respect for family life and the home), Article 13 (Art. 13) (the right to effective national remedies for Convention breaches), Article 14 (Art. 14) (prohibition on discrimination) and Article 18 (Art. 18) (the prohibition on using authorised Convention restrictions for ulterior purposes) of the Convention, as well as Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 (P1-1) to the Convention (the right to property).
label: non-argumentative
events: ['they invoke art', ' to respect life', ' use restriction', ' use purpose']

text: As regards the allegations with regard to the destruction of the applicants' homes and property, the Commission refers to its findings in Application No. 21893/93, Akdivar and others v. Turkey (Dec. 19.10.94) which concerned similar complaints of the destruction of homes and forcible expulsion.
label: non-argumentative
events: [' regard allegation', 'commission refer finding', 'commission refer number', 'company cerne plaint']

text: In that case, the Commission noted that it was a known fact that there had been destruction of villages in South-East Turkey with many people displaced as a result.
label: non-argumentative

text: While the Government had outlined a general scheme of remedies that would normally be available for complaints against the security forces, the Commission found it significant that, although the destruction of houses and property has been a frequent occurrence in South-East Turkey, the Government had not provided a single example of compensation being awarded to villagers for damage like that suffered by the applicants.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['government have outline scheme', 'commission find ', 'government have provide example', ' be award damage', ' suffer applicant']

text: Nor had relevant examples been given of successful prosecutions against members of the security forces for the destruction of villages and the expulsion of villagers.
label: non-argumentative

text: The Commission considered that it seemed unlikely that such prosecutions could follow from acts committed pursuant to the orders of the Regional Governor under the state of emergency to effect the permanent or temporary evacuation of villages, to impose residence prohibitions or to enforce the transfer of people to other areas.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['company sidere ', 'it seem unlikely', 'prosecution follow company', 'prosecution follow mitte', 'ld follow company', 'ld follow mitte', ' to effect evacuation', ' to impose prohibition', ' to enforce transfer']

text: It further had regard to the vulnerability of dispossessed applicants, under pressure from both the security forces and the terrorist activities of the PKK, and held that it could not be said at this stage that their fear of reprisal if they complained about acts of the security forces was wholly without foundation.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['it have regard', 'it have pressure', 'it hold ', 'number be say stage', 'company plain act']

text: The Commission concluded that, in the absence of clear examples that the remedies put forward by the Government would be effective in the circumstances of the case, the applicants were absolved from the obligation to pursue them.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['company clude ', ' put government', 'applicant be absolve obligation', ' to pursue they']
